title: How to recover deleted pictures from an SD card - Quora

response.answer_text: Regardless of the data recovery app to use, there is one thing to do before you get an app and use it to get your photos back. Stop writing to the SD card.WHY? To have the best possible recovery result, it’s recommended to stop using the card. Don’t add any new files to it. If you continue using this card and store new data to it, there is a risk of overwriting the space where your deleted photos existed, which will make it less possible to recover all your deleted photos. The next thing is to get your photos back. There are powerful data recovery software applications to help you recover deleted photos from SD card, as mentioned in this guide How to Recover Deleted Photos from SD Card on Mac and Windows. Below are the steps to recover your deleted photos. Step 1. Connect the SD card to your Mac or PC using a cable or a card reader. Step 3. Launch a data recovery app. The app will detect the internal hard drive and the SD card connected to the computer. Step 4. Select the SD card. Click the scan button or a similar button. The app will scan the card and list the deleted photos for you to scan. You can also preview the deleted photos before you get them recovered. Step 5. Select the photos you need to recover and click the recover button. This is how you can get your photos back. For more details and instructions, you can check out the hyperlinked how-to guide mentioned above.

Losing pictures of some memorable days and moments pinch us a lot, But don’t worry there are data recovery softwares available these days which will help you get back your lost, deleted pictures in a very less amount of time and with good quality. Situation that leads to deletion of Pictures from SD Card: Overuse of SD card even when the device space is full.Usage of SD Card in different devices make it severely corrupted.Format of SD Card because the SD Card is inaccessible which further leads to data loss.Accidental deletion of Pictures in hurry or anything.Virus Attack in SD card.Note: The above situations are very obvious and many users face these issues but as soon as you realize you have lost data stop using the SD Card and start recovering your data because the Data on SD Card is never lost until and unless it is not overwritten by the new ones and if the deleted pictures or data are overwritten by the new ones then they are non-recoverable. Pictures in SD Card can be recovered anytime with the help of photo recovery software. Choose wisely the software, check the software offers the trial version if yes then try the trial version first and then buy the software, check whether the software supports all multimedia files formats, check google reviews and then go ahead with the software. SD cards play a significant role in enlarging the storage capacity of your phone. You can easily switch sd cards when one gets full. This small device comprises a large number of pictures and videos. If you want to recover a picture or a certain file from the SD card then here are two simple ways to do so. Method 1: Recover by using ZAR (for Windows users): The first thing you must do is stop accessing the SD card. If the files have been erased accidentally, there is still a chance that the data is there and has not been overwritten. As soon as you stop accessing the SD card, higher the chances that the data is still there.Download the ZAR demo version from the developer's website.On the ZAR's website, there is an option of "image recovery" at the bottom of the page. Doing so will enable you to download the demo version.Through an SD card reader insert the SD card in your PC. Or you can insert SD card in your camera and connect your camera to PC through USB cableLaunch the ZAR software and tap on the "image recovery (free)" option.Under the heading of "Disks and partitions" click on your SD card. Tap "Next".The next page will display a list of images that the software found on your SD card. Select the images that you want to recover, or you can also select "All" to restore all the lost images. You may not get the option to preview them, and the filenames will probably be different.Create a new folder on your computer and start copying the pictures.Note: you might not be able to retrieve some pictures as they may be partially or fully damaged. Method 2: Recover using Data Rescue 3 (for Mac users) The first thing you must do is stop accessing the SD card. If the files have been erased accidentally, there is still a chance that the data is there and has not been overwritten. As soon as you stop accessing the SD card, higher the chances that the data is still thereDownload the Data Rescue 3 software and run it on your Mac.Insert the USB card in your Mac, however, in case your Mac does not have a USB slot, then use an external USB card reader to insert USB into Mac.From the main homepage of the software, select the option of "Start Recovering Files".The next window will exhibit a list of drivers. Look out for your SD card and tap on it.After that, you will be asked to select the scan method. Select the option of "Deleted Files scan". And click the "Start button".If this method does not produce any results, you can come back and try a "Quick Scan" followed by a "Deep Scan".Once the scan is completed, your screen will display the files that you can recover. Tick the boxes next to the file's name. Select those files that you want to recover.Quick or Deep Scan files can be discovered in the "Found Files" section, while the Deleted Files or Deep Scan files can be discovered in the "Reconstructed Files" section.You can also preview files. Some damaged files might not be available for previewAfter you have made your selection, simply click on the Recover button and choose a location on your Mac where you want to save the files. Click Open after finding an appropriate location for your files.

You want to recover photos from a piece of media you are no longer in possession of? If that is what you are asking and that was the ONLY copy then there is no way to recover them other than finding the “lost SD card”. Only if you are/were using a DSLR or some other camera that has dual slots and supports dual writing to two cards at once as you take photos, would you have a chance. I’m not sure about other brands but with my Nikon, it has two slots and I can have it write every image I take to both cards simultaneously. If I physically lose card 1, card 2 still has every photo since I last formatted.

Use a utility to recover the files. I recall using Easeus data recovery a while back and it worked well, there’s probably others that are also good. This should work unless you didn’t just delete the files, but also overwrote them with other content. If you just did a recycle bin dump or ‘quick format’ the files are still there, they just have the references removed so the OS doesn’t show them.

I recomment Photorec. It’s free, and it does the job, whether your SD card is not recognized by the operating system, or whether you did an accidental quick format. For the record, in-camera format is nearly always a quick format — there rarely any reason to fully format an SD card, and it wears it out faster. I have heard of situations in which Windows wouldn’t recognize an SD card at all, but Linux would. PhotoRec runs on Linux, Windows, MacOS, FreeBSD, etc. It works at the device driver level, below the file system, so it doesn’t actually care if your SD card can be recognize by the OS. Read More PhotoRec - Digital Picture and File Recovery
